content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: There is given the necessary description and I think it's fun to solve it

Nice idea but there's a few problems. First I don't know how well this would work as a reverse puzzle because the "y" letter can be confusing without proper instructions. I would also use shorter sentences if you want to make this reverse. Another problem is what happens with words without vowels in 'aeiou', like "rhythm" or "try". My solution ignored those and passed all tests so you probably don't test for it and I think you most highly should.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Funnier than most string manipulation clashes, nice !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Funny challenge. Good challenge for reverse mode (easy to guess, but special cases : first vowel only, case manipulation....)

you should specify which letters are vowels (y is not in your tests). This saves time in CoC "speed" mode. Test 1 succeed if y is considered as vowel, but validator 1 fails.

Bash answer for my future tests:
echo `tr ' ' '
'|sed 's/[AEIOU]/Alib\L&/;t;s/[aeiou]/alib&/'`

... Validators should be a variation of the test

Validator1 contains a ' , not contained in test 1.

Thanks for the great feedback. I've added a line declaring what vowels are "Vowels are '<<Aa Ee Ii Oo Uu>>' (not 'Yy')."

I've updated Validator 1 to remove the contraction and apostrophe too.

Impressive Bash solution! I don't think I could out-golf that in Ruby...
